programme.title: 2025 NBA Playoffs
programme.desc: Indiana jumped out to a 2-0 lead in the series with a 120-119 win over Cleveland in Game 1 behind a game-winning three-pointer from Tyrese Haliburton with 1.1 seconds left, along with 23 points from both Aaron Nesmith and Myles Turner.

programme.title: 2025 NBA Playoffs
programme.desc: Oklahoma City evened the series at one game apiece with a 149-106 win over Denver in Game 2 behind 34 points from Shai Gilgeous-Alexander and a double-double from Chet Holmgren; Russell Westbrook led the Nuggets with 19 points in the loss.

programme.title: NBA Countdown
programme.desc: Expert analysts preview the upcoming action in the NBA, evaluating the strengths and weaknesses of each team while breaking down the pivotal matchups; coverage includes exclusive interviews, insightful commentary and special features.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: Mike Greenberg, who joined ESPN in 1996 as an anchor, joins former NBA star Jalen Rose for roundtable discussions about the latest sports news making headlines as well as analysis of recent big games and interviews with expert commentators.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee and his friends deliver one-of-a-kind opinions on the latest news making headlines in sports and entertainment, along with special segments and guest interviews with some of the biggest names to give a unique experience.

programme.title: NBA Courtside
programme.desc: Players get prepared for the upcoming game through their warm-up routines, as cameras go around the arena to see the fans get excited with tipoff nearing and capture the pregame energy before the starting five lineups are announced.

programme.desc: The winner in Game 10 between No. 3 seed Texas and No. 11 seed Ole Miss takes on the winner of Game 11 between No. 2 seed Texas A&M and No. 7 seed South Carolina; winner advances to face either top-seeded Oklahoma or No. 5 seed Arkansas.

programme.title: German Bundesliga Soccer
programme.desc: Leipzig claimed a 4-2 victory against Werder Bremen in their first meeting of the season on Jan. 12, led by a first-half brace from Xavi Simons; Benjamin Šeško and Christoph Baumgartner closed out the scoring in the second half of the win.

programme.title: Sport Fishing Television

programme.title: World Surf League
programme.desc: World No. 1 Brisa Hennessy, reigning World Champ Caroline Marks, Caitlin Simmers, Molly Picklum and Johanne Defay are among surfers at event.

programme.title: Bassmaster Elite Series
programme.desc: The highest level of professional bass fishing features pro anglers competing all season for the opportunity to win points toward the Progressive Bassmaster Angler of the Year award and to qualify for the Bassmaster Classic.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: The most talented bowlers in the world compete for lucrative prize money and coveted trophies, challenged by various lane oil patterns throughout the season, requiring bowlers to adjust ball angle, rotation and speed in order to succeed.

programme.title: Motoamerica King of the Baggers Rewind
Indycar INXT Racing
programme.desc: Rookie Dennis Hauger increased his lead over fellow rookie Lochie Hughes to 32 points after a win at Barber to make it two-straight victories to open the season; Jacob Abel and Louis Foster won the two races at Indianapolis last year.

programme.title: STIHL Timbersports Series
programme.desc: Competitive lumberjacks oppose each other in various disciplines based on traditional logging skills in an effort to determine the best all-around lumberjack; Hot Saw, Single Buck, Springboard Chop, Standing Block Chop, Stock Saw and Underhand Chop.

programme.title: Indycar NICS Qualifications
programme.desc: IndyCar drivers aim for the best starting spot in the upcoming race, and the driver with the fastest time is awarded pole position; Alex Palou averaged 127.251 mph to win the pole last year before winning the race over Will Power.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: DC (4-2) dropped two of its last three games after a 38-14 loss to Michigan; San Antonio (1-5) lost two-straight games since defeating the Defenders, 24-18, on April 20 behind two rushing TDs from Aidan Robbins and a passing TD from Kellen Mond.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: DC (4-2) dropped two of its last three games after a 38-14 loss to Michigan; San Antonio (1-5) lost two-straight games since defeating the Defenders, 24-18, on April 20 behind two rushing TDs from Aidan Robbins and a passing TD from Kellen Mond.

programme.title: TMZ Sports Weekend
programme.desc: The biggest sports stories and rumors of the week are covered, as the analysts break down the news surrounding each of the headlines to discuss how those involved will be impacted, along with guest interviews to get an intriguing look at sports.

programme.title: European Poker Tour
programme.desc: Big-money poker events in some of Europe's most exclusive and exciting destinations, features some of the best players in the world attempting to take huge pots by employing the right strategy and taking advantage of their opponents' mistakes.

programme.title: ARCA Racing
programme.desc: Lawless Alan secured his first Menards Series win of his career with his victory at Talladega to move into second behind Lavar Scott by three points; Connor Mosack and Tanner Gray won the two races at Kansas last year over Gray and Connor Zilisch.

programme.title: ARCA Racing
programme.desc: Lawless Alan secured his first Menards Series win of his career with his victory at Talladega to move into second behind Lavar Scott by three points; Connor Mosack and Tanner Gray won the two races at Kansas last year over Gray and Connor Zilisch.

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series
programme.desc: Corey Heim secured his third win of the season and 14th Truck Series win of his career after his victory at Texas over Daniel Hemric; Heim won both races at Kansas last year, averaging 132.722 mph to win the 2024 Heart of America 200.

programme.title: America's Day at the Races
programme.desc: Nationwide coverage of thoroughbred racing from venues around the country, showcasing major stakes races with in-depth analysis from expert handicappers; coverage includes the latest horse racing news, exclusive interviews and insightful commentary.

programme.title: Indycar NICS Practice
programme.desc: IndyCar drivers learn the particulars of the track and communicate to their crew how the car is handling and what adjustments need to be made in order to perform at peak efficiency during the race at Indianapolis; crews work to set up the car.

programme.title: Indycar INXT Racing
programme.desc: Rookie Dennis Hauger increased his lead over fellow rookie Lochie Hughes to 32 points after a win at Barber to make it two-straight victories to open the season; Jacob Abel and Louis Foster won the two races at Indianapolis last year.

programme.desc: IndyCar drivers head out on the track to get ready for the upcoming race with some warmup laps, as analysts preview the Sonsio Grand Prix and two-time defending champion Alex Palou, who comes off his third win in the first four races.

programme.desc: Trey McKinney of Carbondale, Ill. won last year's edition after finishing with a total weight of 130 lbs., 15 ounces, just ahead of Tyler Rivet (125 lbs., 9 oz.) of Raceland, La. to earn $101,000 in total winnings for his first-place finish.
